txt.en: He waits for you to speak again

'Son Khôr-buri-Ghân told of you, [placeholder]. He say you hate gorgûn. Prove to me and Wild Men help friends. Wild Men help horse-men.\n\n'Little time for proving. Horse-men ride for trap. Prove quickly.'
The entrance to Drû Bhûta is flanked by great Púkel-men
'DNT - Blah!'

You introduce yourself as a member of the line of Beorn, a skin-changer of the north, and say from where you have come.

'Wild Men not know Beorn, but do know changers-of-skin.

'You have welcome from Khôr-buri-Ghân, for time. If you prove false you will not live long in forest. You are no friend of gorgûn? Tell Khôr-buri-Ghân now.'

You introduce yourself as a hobbit and say from where you have come.

'Wild Men not know of hobbits. Soft folk? But far from home, perhaps hobbits more tough than first looking.

'You have welcome from Khôr-buri-Ghân, for time. If you prove false you will not live long in forest. You are no friend of gorgûn? Tell Khôr-buri-Ghân now.'
Khôr-buri-Ghân is in the Drúadan Forest.\n\nHe has introduced himself as the son of the chief of the Wild Men, and wants to know who you are and what brings you to his lands.

You introduce yourself as a dwarf and say from where you have come.

'We saw dwarf-kind long ago. All gone now. Burrow into earth away from trees, roots of mountain. Not Wild Man way.

'You have welcome from Khôr-buri-Ghân, for time. If you prove false you will not live long in forest. You are no friend of gorgûn? Tell Khôr-buri-Ghân now.'

You introduce yourself as one of the Elves and say from where you have come.

'Wild Men here before Tall Men came out of water. Heard tell of Elves. Keep to ourselves, be not bothered. Wild Man way so different from Elf-way?

'You have welcome from Khôr-buri-Ghân, for time. If you prove false you will not live long in forest. You are no friend of gorgûn? Tell Khôr-buri-Ghân now.'
'Wild Men live here long time before others. Our land our own. I am called Khôr-buri-Ghân, son of headman Ghân-buri-Ghân.\n\n'Who are you? Why do you come to forest of Wild Men?'
DNT - Blah!
Talk to Mân-weni-Mhên in Drû Bhûta

You introduce yourself and say from where you have come.

'You are friend of Stonehouse-folk? Build walls, long time since they see Wild Men. In danger now.

'You have welcome from Khôr-buri-Ghân, for time. If you prove false you will not live long in forest. You are no friend of gorgûn? Tell Khôr-buri-Ghân now.'
You have encountered one of the Wild Men of the Drúadan Forest. Can he or his people be of help to you?
DNT - Blah!
Talk to Khôr-buri-Ghân at the entrance to Drû Bhûta

You decide that the word gorgûn can only mean Orc-folk, and tell him that you hate gorgûn and their presence on the road has driven you into the forest.\n\n'Khôr-buri-Ghân knew this! Wild Men hate gorgûn. Kill gorgûn whenever come into wood. What do you seek? If it oppose gorgûn, Khôr-buri-Ghân wants it done, will help.'

Khôr-buri-Ghân gave you directions to Drû Bhûta, the village of the Wild Men. He said: 'Drû Bhûta village to west. Must go north-west through rocks, across water. Then back south. Hidden path. Look for narrow path climbing south-west.'\n\nYou hope you can follow that!

You tell him that the Riders of Rohan have set forth from their kingdom to the aid of Gondor, but they will be slowed by the Orcs that have blockaded the road to Minas Tirith. You are unsure if anything can be done to clear the road in time, and tell him so.

'Wild Men may know a way. Not Khôr-buri-Ghân's place to say. Come to Drû Bhûta. Speak to Ghân-buri-Ghân. He will speak for Wild Men.

'Drû Bhûta village to west. Must go north-west through rocks, across water. Then back south. Hidden path. Look for narrow path climbing south-west. Khôr-buri-Ghân see you at front of village.'
'Welcome to Drû Bhûta, village of Wild Men.'
Khôr-buri-Ghân is waiting to welcome you to the village of Drû Bhûta.

'Welcome to Drû Bhûta, village of Wild Men. Cause no harm here. You will find it place of peace.\n\n'I speak to father Ghân-buri-Ghân. Explore village. Meet Wild Men and learn our customs. I will see you here when done. Then bring to headman.'
Khôr-buri-Ghân's fellow Wild Men can be found throughout their village of Drû Bhûta.
Talk to Ghân-buri-Ghân

'Stonehouse-folk built walls high, built walls strong. Now gorgûn surround walls. No more leaving for Stonehouse-folk.\n\n'That not Wild Man way. Stay hidden in wood. Gorgûn killed by arrows before see any Wild Man. Stonehouse-folk could have learned lesson, if listened. Never listen. Now trapped behind own wall.'
He waits for your answer
'DNT - Blah!'

'Wild Men hear word of much from forest. Horse-men pass by, never seeing. They find gorgûn if keep going. Headman say not to interfere. Maybe will, maybe not. Wild Men do as Ghân say. Wise leader know when to fight, know when not to fight.\n\n'Many folk could learn difference.'
'DNT - Blah!'
'Son of headman killed by gorgûn.'
Talk to Khôr-buri-Ghân and answer his question
Khôr-buri-Ghân is at the entrance to Drû Bhûta.
'Horse-men pass by, never seeing Wild Men.'
'Headman see you now. Ghân-buri-Ghân has words to speak. May help [placeholder], may help horse-men. Go and see.'
'I speak to father Ghân-buri-Ghân.'
'Headman see you now.'
Talk to Khôr-buri-Ghân and tell him what you seek
Find the entrance to Drû Bhûta, the village of the Wild Men
'You hate gorgûn? Prove to me and Wild Men help friends.'
'Why do you come to forest of Wild Men?'
Talk to Khôr-buri-Ghân at the entrance to Drû Bhûta
'Welcome to village of Wild Men.'
Talk to Âm-buri-Sôl in Drû Bhûta
'Headman see you now.'
Talk to Wêg-pulo-Ghûr in Drû Bhûta
Ghân-buri-Ghân, the leader of the Wild Men, can be found in the village of Drû Bhûta.

'Wild Men not always beat gorgûn. Son of headman killed by gorgûn. Died outside wood, brought to camp. Bhai-buri-Ghân brother of Khôr-buri-Ghân. Gorgûn pay when Ghân-buri-Ghân decide to act. Not yet. Soon.\n\n'Gorgûn think they win, but gorgûn wrong. Soon will see.'
'I speak to father Ghân-buri-Ghân. Explore village. Meet Wild Men and learn our customs. I will see you here when done. Then bring to headman.'
'Headman see you now. Ghân-buri-Ghân has words to speak. May help [placeholder], may help horse-men. Go and see.'
Khôr-buri-Ghân is in the Drúadan Forest.\n\nHe has introduced himself as the son of the chief of the Wild Men, and wants to know if you are a friend of the gorgûn.
Khôr-buri-Ghân is in the Drúadan Forest.\n\nHe has introduced himself as the son of the chief of the Wild Men, and wants to know what you are seeking and if it will prove harmful to the gorgûn.
'You are no friend of gorgûn?'
'Wild Men hate gorgûn.'
'Wild Men may know a way. Speak to Ghân-buri-Ghân.'
Talk to Khôr-buri-Ghân and tell him about yourself
'Welcome to village of Wild Men.'
'Gorgûn surround Stone-houses. No more leaving for Stonehouse-folk.'
Book 5, Chapter 3: Older Than the Hills
